definition: to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
flatterer
to curry favor/to get the desired outcome by flattery
to fawn upon sb in every possible way

sentences.english: It's similar to when someone is flattering us.
sentences.chinese: 這就像有人奉承我們時候的感覺。

sentences.english: She was pleased with his flatteries.
sentences.chinese: 聽了他的奉承話，她心裏很樂。

sentences.english: An act or instance of cringing.
sentences.chinese: 帶有媚態和奉承的順從。

sentences.english: Those behave fawningly to rich one have no money received and that means they offer their soul, their dignity for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 奉承的人沒有錢收而獻出他們的靈魂他們的尊嚴。

sentences.english: It's a fine line between expressing admiration and being obsequious.
sentences.chinese: 在讚美和奉承之間有微妙的區別。

sentences.english: Flattery is the best persuader of people.

sentences.chinese: 難道你沒發現奉承拍馬很有好處？

sentences.english: He likes to make flattering remarks.
Jack bootlicked to get a promotion;
sentences.chinese: 傑克阿諛奉承以得到晉升。

sentences.english: The same man cannot be both friendflatterer.
sentences.chinese: 朋友與奉承者不會是同一個人。

sentences.english: A wise man is superior to flattery.
sentences.chinese: 一個智者是不會被阿諛奉承所迷惑的。

sentences.english: Consumers are courted, enticed, and implored by sellers of goods and services.
sentences.chinese: 消費者受到商品和勞務出售者奉承。

sentences.english: He thrived on the adulation of his henchman.
sentences.chinese: 他靠下屬的奉承而發跡。

sentences.english: Our own vanity is the worst flatterer.
sentences.chinese: 我們的虛榮心是最壞的奉承者。

sentences.english: Compliments heard second-hand have more credibility within the intended recipient.
sentences.chinese: 二手讚美比刻意在人前奉承更能取信於人。

definition: to flatter/to toady
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to praise/to speak highly of/compliment/praise
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
(honorific) to greet/to fawn
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
toady/bootlicker
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
horse hindquarters/flattery/boot-licking
to flatter
polite greeting/civilities/to exchange pleasantries
